Emotions
  • Model Training
  • View page source

Model Training

This process is used for model training. The model used is RoBERTa model with the input number of output classes.

See RoBERTa model for more information.

model_training.batch_predict_and_decode(model, inputs, label_encoder, batch_size=256)

Predicts the emotion labels for the input data and returns the predicted labels and the highest probabilities.

Input:

model: Model used for prediction. inputs: Dictionary containing the input data. label_encoder: Label encoder used to decode the predicted classes. batch_size: Batch size for the prediction.

Output:

predicted_emotions: List of predicted emotion labels. highest_probabilities: List of highest probabilities for each predicted emotion.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.create_tf_datasets(token_ids, mask_values, labels, test_size=0.2, random_state=42, batch_size=256)

Creates TensorFlow datasets for training and validation.

Input:

token_ids: Numpy array of token IDs. mask_values: Numpy array of mask values. labels: Encoded labels. test_size: Size of the validation dataset. random_state: Random state for reproducibility. batch_size: Batch size for the datasets.

Output:

training_dataset: TensorFlow dataset for training the model. validation_dataset: TensorFlow dataset for validating the model.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.encode_labels(emotional_labels)

Encodes the emotional labels using a LabelEncoder and returns the transformed labels and the encoder.

Input:

emotional_labels: List of emotional labels to be encoded.

Output:

transformed_labels: Encoded labels. encoder: LabelEncoder used to encode the labels.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.evaluate(eval_data: DataFrame, model, tokenizer, label_encoder)

Evaluate the model using the evaluation data.

Input:

eval_data (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing the evaluation data. model: The trained model to be evaluated. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input data. label_encoder: Label encoder used to decode the predicted classes.

Output:

predicted_emotions: List of predicted emotion labels. highest_probabilities: List of highest probabilities for each predicted emotion. accuracy: Accuracy score of the model. report: Classification report of the model’s performance.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.get_model(model_path: str, num_classes: int)

Create and return a RoBERTa model with the specified number of output classes.

Input:

weights_path (str): Path to the model weights file. num_classes (int): Number of output classes for the model.

Output:

model: RoBERTa model with the specified number of output classes. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input data.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.load_data(file_path: str, dataset: str) → tuple[DataFrame, dict[int, str]]

Load the dataset from a CSV file and return the DataFrame and a dictionary with the classes.

Input:

file_path (str): File path to the dataset CSV file. dataset (str): Type of dataset to load (‘train’ or ‘eval’).

Output:

df (pd.DataFrame): Loaded DataFrame containing the data. classes (dict[int, str]): Dictionary with the class labels.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.predict(model, sentences: list, tokenizer, label_encoder, batch_size=256)

A function that takes a pre-trained model, a list of sentences, a tokenizer, and a label encoder to predict the emotion labels for the input sentences. It returns the predicted emotions and the highest probabilities for each prediction.

Input:

model: Model used for prediction. sentences (list): List of input sentences. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input sentences. label_encoder: Label encoder used to encode the predicted classes. batch_size (int): Batch size for prediction.

Output:

predicted_emotions: List of predicted emotion labels for the input sentences. highest_probabilities: List of highest probabilities for each predicted emotion.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.preprocess_data(df: DataFrame, tokenizer)

A function to preprocess the input data.

Input:

df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing the input data. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input data.

Output:

training_dataset: Training dataset for the model. validation_dataset: Validation dataset for the model. encoder.classes_: Encoded classes for the model. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input data.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.tokenize_sentences(sentences, tokenizer, max_length=128)

Tokenizes the input sentences using the provided tokenizer and returns the token IDs and mask values.

Input:

sentences: List of sentences to be tokenized. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input data. max_length: Maximum length of the tokenized sequences.

Output:

token_ids: Tensor of token IDs. mask_values: Tensor of mask values.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.tokenize_text_data(text_data, tokenizer, max_length=128)

Tokenizes the input text data using the provided tokenizer and returns the token IDs and mask values.

Input:

text_data: List of text data to be tokenized. tokenizer: Tokenizer used to tokenize the input data. max_length: Maximum length of the tokenized sequences.

Output:

token_ids_array: Numpy array of token IDs. mask_values_array: Numpy array of mask values.

Author:

Max Meiners (214936)

model_training.train_model(model, training_dataset, validation_dataset, epochs=3)

Train the model using the training dataset.

Input:

model: Model to be trained. training_dataset: Dataset used for training the model. validation_dataset: Dataset used for validating the model. epochs (int): Number of epochs to train the model.

Output:

model: Trained model.
